title: Correct proxy setting for background update
content:
Hi all, trying to configure autoupdate settings for my org, as we're discovering several out of date installations.

One sticking point I'm seeing is that I see conflicting documentation on the required proxy setting for background updates to work.

This page states that the correct proxy setting is to use system settings https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/enable-background-updates-firefox-windows

Meanwhile, this page states that proxy settings must not be configured. https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/toolkit/mozapps/update/docs/BackgroundUpdates.html

Which one is authoritative?

as an aside, some of the required prefs cited in the second document don't appear in about:config on the current version. I do see app.update.background.allowUpdatesForUnelevatedInstallations and app.update.auto.migrated which I'm assuming for the moment are the correct prefs, but can that be confirmed?
creator: dan.spengler

title: Asian Language Input Method Inactive in Webpage Text Fields After Navigation via Bookmarks or Copy/Paste in Firefox 135.0.1
content:
Description:

In Firefox version 135.0.1, when navigating to a website by clicking a bookmark or by pasting a URL (without first activating an Asian language input method in the address bar), Asian language input methods are inactive within webpage text fields. Only English characters can be entered. Switching languages or input methods has no effect.

Steps to Reproduce: 

   Open Firefox 135.0.1.    Navigate to a website by clicking a bookmark or by pasting a URL into the address bar (do not activate an Asian language input method in the address bar before navigating).    Click on a text field within the webpage.    Attempt to activate an Asian language input method.

Expected Result:

The Asian language input method should activate, allowing the user to enter characters in the selected language.

Actual Result:

The Asian language input method remains inactive. Only English characters can be entered.

Workaround:

Clicking on the address bar and activating an Asian language input method there enables the input method to function correctly in webpage text fields afterward. This workaround persists for all webpages within the same Firefox window. Alternatively, if the user first types an URL into the address bar, while using an asian language input method, the problem does not occur.

Environment: 

   Browser: Firefox 135.0.1    Operating System: Windows 11    Input Methods: Microsoft Chinese Input and Microsoft Japanese Input (both exhibit the same issue)    Websites: Google, Bing, Yahoo and other websites.

Additional Information:

This issue does not occur in Microsoft Edge.
creator: Shos

title: Some Menus Have an Extra Column on the Left Side
content:
Hi All,

I noticed that my drop-down menus are not visually consistent.

The "File" and "View" menus have an extra column on the left side, while the remaining menus do not have this extra space.

I'm not sure if this column is for icons that are not displaying, or if it serves some other function.

title: News Feed
content:
Why is my news feed nothing but left wing garbage, from Politico, NPR, CBS. ABC, NBC, MSNBC, to Time to Huff Post, there is nothing Center or Center Right, it is all Lame Stream Left Wing Garbage.

What's up with that? We need some ideological diversity, in other words not Group Think.

I want some Fox News, Breitbart, Daily Wire, Town Hall Media, etc., and to be balanced you can throw in your current biased feed too. At least then, I can read the issues from several points of view, which after all, that is what it is all about.

Otherwise just leave my news feed splash page empty, I am quite adept at using several news sources for m information on the news of the day.

Don't ever forget your company fired your Founder and CEO for "wrong think."

Matt
